titles.title: National Biological Survey Act of 1993
A bill to provide for a National Biological Survey, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S7238-7239)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

term.name: Advice and consent of the Senate

bill.summary: 6/15/1993--Introduced. National Biological Survey Act of 1993 - Title I: National Biological Survey - Directs the Secretary of the Interior (Secretary) to establish a National Biological Survey to: (1) consolidate and enhance biological research activities of the Department of the Interior; and (2) gather, analyze, and disseminate biological information to foster greater understanding and wise stewardship of the United States' living resources. Directs the Secretary to establish: (1) the National Biological Survey Science Council; and (2) the National Biological Survey Policy Board. Title II: Resource Management Training - Authorizes the Director of the National Biological Survey to develop a natural resource management training program. Provides for the confidentiality of information concerning the location of any candidate, threatened, or endangered species, with provisions for disclosure to Governors of affected States.
